comments:
I have the source of the Java bean linked in from another project, and am trying to use the wizard to generate a new web service from the bean.  Below is the stacktrace, and I will attach copies of the log and screenshot.


Unable to add the follwing facets to project SecureMessagingWS: Axis2 Web Services Extensions, Axis2 Web Services Core.
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Failed while installing Axis2 Web Services Core 1.1.
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.callDelegate(FacetedProject.java:1230)

    at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.utils.ContentCopyUtils.makeFolderPathAtLocation(ContentCopyUtils.java:185)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.utils.ContentCopyUtils.makeFolderPathAtLocation(ContentCopyUtils.java:230)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.utils.ContentCopyUtils.copyDirectoryRecursivelyIntoWorkspace(ContentCopyUtils.java:103)

    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.callDelegate(FacetedProject.java:1201)

Additionally: using Eclipse 3.3 with the JBoss IDE plugin.

Created an attachment (id=78655)
Screen shot of error and source dialog

Created an attachment (id=78658)
Screen shot showing error adding Axis facets to project
The failure is an NPE in org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.utils.ContentCopyUtils.makeFolderPathAtLocation(). Changing the component accordingly.

Alexandra, 

Did you go to the Web service preference -> Axis2 Preferences -> Axis2 Runtime to set the Axis2 runtime location (you need to first download Axis2 1.2 or newer to your disk and unzip).  My guess is you just created a dynamic Web project and choose the Axis2 Web service runtime but might not have set the Axis2 runtime location.  If that's the case, the error message you will get is:

Unable to add the follwing facets to project a: Axis2 Web Services Core, Axis2 Web Services Extensions.
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Failed while installing Axis2 Web Services Core 1.1.
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.callDelegate(FacetedProject.java:1259)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.modifyInternal(FacetedProject.java:398)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.access$2(FacetedProject.java:290)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject$1.run(FacetedProject.java:272)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1797)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.modify(FacetedProject.java:282)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.common.FacetUtils$1.run(FacetUtils.java:767)
    at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[0]: org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: The Axis2 facets cannot be installed since the Axis2 runtime location has not been set.
    Please go to the Web Services preference page and set the Axis2 runtime location under Axis2 Preferences.
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.deligate.Axis2CoreFacetInstallDelegate.execute(Axis2CoreFacetInstallDelegate.java:48)

We already have bug 184450 to address a better more concise error message which just tells the user to set the Axis2 runtime location in Axis2 preference.

Even though the first part of the stack trace is similar to yours, your stack trace has:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[0]: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.utils.ContentCopyUtils.makeFolderPathAtLocation(ContentCopyUtils.java:185)

which is different.  

May be you could try to set the Axis2 install location and try your scenario again.  If that works, this is a dup of 184450.  We still need to find out why you are getting an NPE in ContentCopyUtils.makeFolderPathAtLocation.  Could you please clarify what exactly you did to re-create the problem?  Did you created a Web project with non-default location?  I even tried that but still just got the above error, not the stack trace you reported.

I did do this. Part of the problem was that Eclipse would not allow me to add the Axis facets to the project. I installed Axis 2-1.3.  I am not sure what is odd with that particular project but I simply recreated a new Web Services project and was able to add Axis facets to it and do the same operations without any problem.

If anyone wants a copy of this project (zip) I will gladly provide, but I will mark this as invalid as 1) I cannot reproduce it by creating a new project and 2) the workaround of creating a new project seems to have resolved the issue.

(In reply to comment #6)

Please attach the project zip to this issue, I ll have a look at it. 
Thanks 
Lahiru
